```{r setup, include=FALSE}

# include libraries
library(flexdashboard)
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)
library(ggthemes)
library(cowplot)
library(hrbrthemes)
library(knitr)
library(zoo) # moving averages

# get the data - leave for quick testing one file
load("../data/covid.RData")
covid <- covid %>% arrange(dateupdated)

# Filters the data for a specified county, which is specified as a parameter
# in the R Markdown file, and graphs the number of cases for this county ovr time.
covid_county <- covid %>% filter(county == params$data)

# get date range
beginDate <- format.Date(first(covid$dateupdated), '%m/%d/%Y')
lastDate <- format.Date(last(covid$dateupdated), '%m/%d/%Y')

# Filters the data to look at only the most recent date 
# covid_mr means covid most recent
endDate <- last(covid$dateupdated)
covid_mr <- covid %>% filter(dateupdated == endDate) 
```

### **Total Cases per County**

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}
tcc <- ggplot(data = covid_mr, aes(x=county, y = totalcases, fill = county)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") + labs(x = "", y = "Total Cases") + theme_classic() +
  theme(legend.position = "none") + theme(axis.text.x=element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 0.9, size = 11))

ggplotly(tcc, dynamicTicks = TRUE) %>% 
  config(displayModeBar = F) %>% 
  layout(xaxis=list(fixedrange=TRUE, yaxis=list(fixedrange=TRUE)))
```

### **Total Deaths per County**

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}
tdc <- ggplot(data = covid_mr, aes(x=county, y = totaldeaths, fill = county)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") + labs(x = "", y = "Total Deaths") + theme_classic() +
  theme(legend.position = "none") + theme(axis.text.x=element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 0.9, size = 11))

ggplotly(tdc, dynamicTicks = TRUE) %>% 
  config(displayModeBar = F) %>% 
  layout(xaxis=list(fixedrange=TRUE, yaxis=list(fixedrange=TRUE)))
```

### **County Hospitalizations Over Time**

```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}
# Generates a graph of total cases over time for each county 
# plot cases over time
hot <- ggplot(covid, aes(dateupdated, hospitalization, color = county)) +
  geom_line() + theme_classic() + xlab('') + ylab('Hospitalizations')

ggplotly(hot, dynamicTicks = TRUE) %>%
  config(displayModeBar = F) %>%
  layout(xaxis=list(autorange=TRUE, yaxis=list(autorange=TRUE)))
```
